translations.translation: (Shu'aib) said: "My Lord knows well what you are doing."
Shuayb said: "My Lord knows well all what you do."
He said, "My Lord knows all that you do."
He said, “My Lord is Well Aware of what you do.”
He said: "My Lord is the Best Knower of what you do."
He said: My Lord knows best what you do.
He said, 'My Lord knows very well what you are doing.'
He said: My Lord is Best Aware of what ye do.
He said, "My Lord has full knowledge of all your actions."
He. said: My Lord is the Best Knower of that which ye work.
He said, ‘My Lord knows best what you are doing.’
He said: "My Lord knows best what ye do."
He said: "My Lord is the Best Knower of what you do."
He said: 'My Lord knows what you are doing'
He said, “My Lord is Well Aware of what you do.”
He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."
[26:188] He said, ‘My Lord knows best what you are doing’, and will requite you for it.
(He said) Shu'ayb said: (My Lord is best aware of what ye do) in your state of disbelief, and He is more aware of you and your punishment.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وبعدما آيس شعيب عليه السلام عن إيمانهم { قَالَ } لهم مشتكياً إلى الله: { رَبِّيۤ أَعْلَمُ } بعلمه الحضوري { بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ } [الشعراء: 188] من أنواع الفسادات، وبمقدار ما تستحقون عليها من الجزاء والعذاب
